# pdfn

> Write PDF templates as React components. Server-side, Chromium-based PDF generation with predictable pagination, headers, footers, and Tailwind support.

## Overview

- [README](/README.md): Full documentation, examples, and API reference

## Quick Reference

### Installation

```bash
# React projects
npm i @pdfn/react

# Plain Node.js
npm i react react-dom @pdfn/react

# With Tailwind
npm i @pdfn/tailwind
```

### Basic Example

```tsx
import React from 'react';
import { Document, Page, PageNumber, generate } from '@pdfn/react';

function Invoice() {
  return (
    <Document title="Invoice">
      <Page size="A4" margin="1in" footer={<PageNumber />}>
        <h1 style={{ fontSize: 24 }}>Invoice #001</h1>
        <p>Total: $148.00</p>
      </Page>
    </Document>
  );
}

async function main() {
  const pdf = await generate(<Invoice />);
}
main();
```

> **Note:** `generate()` requires a pdfn API key. Alternatively, use `render()` + Puppeteer to self-host.

### Components

| Component | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| `<Document>` | Root wrapper with metadata, fonts, CSS |
| `<Page>` | Page container with size, margins, header/footer |
| `<PageNumber>` | Current page number |
| `<TotalPages>` | Total page count |
| `<PageBreak>` | Force page break |
| `<AvoidBreak>` | Keep content together |
| `<Thead repeat>` | Repeating table header |
| `<Tr keep>` | Non-splitting table row |

### Functions

| Function | Returns | Requires |
|----------|---------|----------|
| `render()` | HTML string | Nothing (use with your own Puppeteer) |
| `generate()` | PDF buffer | API key (or use render() to self-host) |

Both produce identical PDFs — choose based on infrastructure preferences.

### Project Structure

Templates are stored in the `pdfn-templates/` folder by convention:

```
your-project/
├── pdfn-templates/           # PDF templates (convention)
│   ├── styles.css            # Tailwind theme (optional)
│   ├── styles/               # Plain CSS files
│   │   └── contract.css
│   ├── invoice.tsx
│   └── contract.tsx
└── ...
```

### Styling Options

1. **Inline styles** - `style={{ fontSize: 24 }}`
2. **CSS prop** - `<Document css={\`.class { ... }\`}>`
3. **Tailwind** - `<Tailwind>` wrapper with `pdfn-templates/styles.css`
